publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-364 Alasdair Allan: Gaelic Films—That the Parliament welcomes the premiere of the first ever Gaelic feature film, Seachd: The Inaccessible Pinnacle, on Thursday 16 August 2007; notes that this is a great step forward for the Gaelic arts industry and Gaelic cinema; wishes the producers of the film success in their possible nomination for a foreign-language Oscar; believes that initiatives like this are needed to aid the long-term survival prospects of Gaelic as a spoken community language, and looks forward to many more similar Gaelic productions and initiatives in the future. The member has provided the following Gaelic translation: Gu bheil am Pàrlamaid a cuir fàilte air a’ phrìomh-thaisbeanadh dhen a’ chiad fiolm Gàidhlig fhada, ‘Seachd: The Innaccessible Pinnacle’, air Diardaoin 16 An Lùnasdal 2007; fhios gu bheil seo ceum mòr air adhart airson gnìomhachas ealain na Ghàidhlig agus cinema na Ghàidhlig; a’ thoirt dùrachdan don riochdairean a’ fiolm airson ainmeachadh mar Oscar cànain chèin; a’ creideamh gu bheil iomairtean mar seo feumail airson cuideachadh a thoirt dhan Gàidhlig mar chànain coimhearsnachd anns an t-àm ri teachd, agus a’ coimhead air adhart gu tòrr riochdachaidhean agus iomairtean Gàidhlig co-ionnan anns an t-àm ri teachd. Supported by: Rob Gibson*, Ken Macintosh*, Nanette Milne*, Christine Grahame*, Bill Kidd*, Bashir Ahmad*, Andrew Welsh*, Mary Scanlon*, Sandra White*, Bob Doris*, Bill Wilson*, Ian McKee*
S3M-364 Gaelic Films (lodged on 15 August 2007) Dave Thompson*, Gil Paterson*, Jamie Hepburn*
